newsitem.title: UK: Cobham firm acquires Continental Microwave.
newsitem.headline: Cobham firm acquires Continental Microwave.

text.p: UK's Cobham Plc said on Monday that its unit Chelton Communications had taken over Continental Microwave and Tool Co for a total consideration of 8.6 million stg.
Chelton paid an initial amount of 7.3 million stg and would pay another 1.3 million stg over five years. The value of the net assets acquired was 1.8 million stg, the statement said.
Continental, based in New Hampshire in the United States, makes microwave communication waveguides for use on space satellites and for aviation applications.
Continental's December 1996 sales is expected to exceed 7.2 million stg, up from 5.4 millions stg in the previous year. The company reported a pre-tax profit of one million stg in 1995.
"The level of profitability will increase materially following certain organisational changes made at the time of acquisition," the statement said.
